title: Procter & Gamble, Netflix, Robinhood, Occidental: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Robinhood's shares inched higher premarket; Rising crude prices were lifting stocks of producers
text:
* Aerospace composites specialist Hexcel reported a profit for the third quarter, but continued to withhold guidance due to pandemic uncertainties. Shares slipped 1.5%.

* Philip Morris International, Halliburton and Procter & Gamble are due to report earnings before the opening bell.

* Robinhood Markets rose 1.6% premarket. The Securities and Exchange Commission said Monday that this year's trading frenzy in GameStop should lead regulators to consider whether "game-like" brokerage apps are encouraging people to trade too much.

* Occidental Petroleum ticked up 1.9% after Truist Financial raised its price target for shares of the oil producer.

* Teladoc Health gained 2.1% after Wells Fargo recommended investors buy shares of the virtual healthcare company.

* E-commerce firm Carvana rose 3.8% in thin trading. Analysts at Wedbush bumped up their target price for the stock last week.

* Johnson & Johnson shares were up 0.7% premarket. The pharmaceutical company logged a larger profit in its third quarter, lifted by higher sales in its pharmaceutical, medical-device and consumer-health divisions.

* Netflix and United Airlines are due to report after the close.

Chart of the Day

* China's economy has been taking it from all sides: power outages, the property debt fiasco, snarled shipping lanes and, a bit further back, a brief but damaging Delta variant outbreak. Given how modest countercyclical support has been so far, next quarter will almost certainly be worse, writes Heard on the Street columnist Nathaniel Taplin.

Write to Joe Wallace at joe.wallace@wsj.com
